intro: Sida monticola, commonly known as mountain sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pink or white flowers and has hairy, ovate leaves. Sida monticola is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
